poem:
"Testimony On The Winds"

The stillness of the unimpressed,
A landscape crumbled, painted bare.
Deeds rolled out in harsh, lurid unrest,
A sultry specter in public square.

Regrettable acts retold in court's cold air,
A testimony clear, a view from afar,
Yet, deaf are those, to truth's blare,
In the shadow of an unmoving star.
